com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database

Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database.DatabaseManager

  • public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Decides what Data Access Object (DAO) can be access at the time
    Author:
    Allan Manuba

      androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<Driver> logInAsDriver(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner owner)
      Deprecated. 
      logInAsDriver was replaced by LogInRegisterDAO.logInAsDriver. Here's how to replace your code: 

            // for consistency with other methods
      DatabaseManager db = DatabaseManager.getInstance();
      LoginRegisterDAO dao = db.getLoginRegisterDAO();
      MutableLiveData driver = dao.logInAsDriver(...);
      driver.observe(this, driver -> {...});

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        @NonNull
public static DatabaseManager getInstance()
        If the app was opened fresh, then it would seem like that the user's logged out even if they're logged in. Current logged in state can also be ambiguous if this was used, allowing unauthorized access to some DAO's. Always call verify after getting the instance, or use getInstance(Context, LifecycleOwner)
        Returns:
        Returns a DatabaseManager instance without verification.
        See Also:
        getInstance(Context, LifecycleOwner)

      • getInstance

        @Nullable
public static androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<DatabaseManager> getInstance(android.content.Context context,
                                                                                         androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner owner)
        If the app was opened fresh, it would verify if the user was logged in previously.
        Parameters:
        context -
        owner -
        Returns:
        Returns a MutableLiveData which should be observed.
        • If the verification succeeds, the observer receives a DatabaseManager instance with the right access level
        • If the verification does not succeed, the observer receives a null object

      • updateUser

        public <U extends User> void updateUser(@Nullable
                                        U user)
        Updates the current user. This will control access to DAO's For example:
        • If logged out, only LogInRegisterDAO can be accessed
        • If driver is logged in, only driver related DAO's can be accessed
        • If rider is logged in, only rider related DAO's can be accessed
        Parameters:
        user - Rider model or Driver model who is currently logged in If null, sets the access level to LoggedOut

      • logInAsRider

        @Deprecated
public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<Rider> logInAsRider(java.lang.String username,
                                                                           java.lang.String password,
                                                                           androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner owner)
        Deprecated. logInAsRider was replaced by LogInRegisterDAO.logInAsRider. Here's how to replace your code: 

              // for consistency with other methods
      DatabaseManager db = DatabaseManager.getInstance();
      LoginRegisterDAO dao = db.getLoginRegisterDAO();
      MutableLiveData rider = dao.logInAsRider(...);
      rider.observe(this, rider -> {...});
        See Also:
        LoginRegisterDAO.logInAsRider(String, String, LifecycleOwner)
